member.name: T:DivideLines.DivideLines
member.summary: Tool with an embeded control for dividing a polyline into number of parts of equal length or parts of a certain length.

member.name: M:DivideLines.DivideLines.#ctor
member.remarks: Defines the embeded control the tool is associated with. See config.daml. Set as maptool.

member.name: M:DivideLines.DivideLinesViewModel.DivideLinesAsync(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Divide the first selected feature into equal parts or by map unit distance.
member.param: Value for number or parts or distance.

member.name: M:DivideLines.frmDivideBy.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DivideLines.frmDivideBy.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:DivideLines.Module1
member.summary: This sample provides a tool that divides a line into an equal number of parts or a number of parts of a given length.
member.remarks:
This sample creates a map tool that is similar to other editing tools in the Modify Features pane, in that it opens a control within the pane with a dialog for user input. It follows the MVVM pattern used by the editing tools.
To use this sample:
Debug through Visual Studio or compile and run ArcGIS Pro.
In Pro, add or create a map with lines.
Select a single line in the map.
Click the Divide Lines tool in the Divide group within the Modify Features pane.
In the pane for Divide Lines, select the option and enter a value. Click on Divide.
The selected line should be divided and the selection cleared. The tool remains active to enable selection of other lines to repeat the process. ![UI](Screenshots/Screen.png)

member.name: M:DivideLines.Module1.CanUnload
member.summary: Called by Framework when ArcGIS Pro is closing
member.returns: False to prevent Pro from closing, otherwise True

member.name: P:DivideLines.Module1.Current
member.summary: Retrieve the singleton instance to this module here
